channel.title: Client.java:822: error: ')' expected

item.title: Client.java:822: error: ')' expected
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“D 3 4 T H 317, post:3, topic:548713”]im having that same issue… its just getting in the way of my coding… :palm:

				byte abyte0[] = aByteArrayArray1183[i3];
				if (FileOperations.FileExists(signlink.findcachedir()+"/maps/"+anIntArray1235[i3]+".dat")  <---this one
						abyte0 = FileOperations.ReadFile(signlink.findcachedir()+"/maps/"+anIntArray1235[i3+".dat");
				if(abyte0 != null)
						objectManager.method180(abyte0, k5, i4, (anInt1069 - 6) * 8, (anInt1070 - 6) * 8, aClass11Array1230);
			}

I do what it says and simply add another “)” before this one… and even out the open and close parenthesis… and I compile and it comes up with 85 errors.

compile error: client.java:724: error “)” expected

if (FileOperations.FileExists(signlink.findcachedir()+“maps/”+anIntArray1235[i3]+".dat")

please help im trying to code my own ideas but this error is getting in the way as you can tell help![/quote]

Again.

sk8rdude461:

You have 2 open parenthesis and 1 closing. Do the math.

Let me make it more apparent to you:

if [size=14pt]([/size]FileOperations.FileExistssize=14pt[/size]

Now, can you see which one is missing?

Read full topic

item.title: Client.java:822: error: ')' expected
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You have 2 open parenthesis and 1 closing. Do the math.

Also, that if statement shouldn’t end with a semicolon.
